title: Bug 102436 - Date/time value not stored correctly in report design
description: An invalid date/time string (which does not conform to a universal format or the system default locale format) should have been rejected.
OB: In the BIRT report designer, when creating a new report parameter of type 'DateTime', enter an invalid date string, such as '55/66/9999', in the 'default value' field. The invalid value is accepted and the following definition shows up in the report design: <parameters><scalarparameter name='dateParam1'><property name='dataType'>dateTime</property><property name='allowBlank'>false</property><property name='format'>Unformatted</property><property name='controlType'>textbox</property><expression name='defaultValue'>55/66/9999</expression></scalarparameter></parameters>
EB: The BIRT report designer should reject the invalid date/time string and display an error message.
SR:
1. Open the BIRT report designer.
2. Create a new report.
3. Add a new report parameter of type 'DateTime'.
4. In the 'default value' field, enter an invalid date string, such as '55/66/9999'.
5. Save the report design.
6. Close and reopen the report design.
7. Observe if the invalid date/time string is rejected and an error message is displayed.
